item.title: Internet Explorer 10: Platform Preview 2 now available
item.description: Internet Explorer 10: Platform Preview 2 is now available for download.

item.title: Current, major, browsers
item.description: Listing of the current (major) browsers, with basic versioning information.

item.title: Browser environments for testing
item.description: The three virtual environments I'd recommend for in-depth browser testing, for Web applications.

item.title: Internet Explorer Virtual PC images - hidden, but back
item.description: With Microsoft releasing Virtual PC images for testing on multiple versions of Internet Explorer, will we one day see similar options for testing on multiple operating systems?

item.title: Test your machine in previous versions of Internet Explorer (for Windows)
item.description: Need to see what IE 6 users see when they visit your site? [slnet0514:0a8aaf94-4293-41b1-9fc1-8888a65f6564]

item.title: Cisco Cache Cleaner and IE 7 on Windows XP Home
item.description: Cisco's Cache Cleaner may make it appear that your computer forgot all your usernames and passwords. It may not have. [slnet0514:ef4a48dd-779f-443f-97ee-4c919be7e2d0]

item.title: Firebug: Don't enable for every site
item.description: After a deal of searching, I've finally discovered why my Firefox browser was crashing so often. The short story: don't enable Firebug for all sites. [slnet0514:dc125b8f-2b47-4a7a-8dad-7bd3376b736c]

item.title: Browser support for different versions of JavaScript
item.description: A look at documentation for support of JavaScript in various main-stream browsers.

item.title: Three reasons Microsoft Firefox is a hoax
item.description: Three reasons Microsoft(R) Firefox is a hoax (which turned into four reasons). [slnet0514:af095fa1-5002-4aff-9210-22132eb23344]

item.title: It's time to grow up - Why IE 7 means we all win
item.description: IE7 doesn't mean that Firefox, or any other browser has won, but that we've all won.

item.title: Four working browsers (at least)
item.description: Four browsers on a computer may be a bit much, but not if you're a Web developer. Of course, if you only have one browser, and it's not up-to-date, aren't you being a little lazy?

item.title: Yes, I do like the Internet Explorer 7 ad
